intro: Cassiniola, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. Cassiniola typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardiness.
